source.author: Lepschi, B.J.
source.title: Leptomeria
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Lepschi, B.J. (1999). Leptomeria. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Branchlets flexible to more or less rigid, subterete to prominently angular, longitudinally ridged, not pungent; erect, occasionally broom-like shrubs of open- forests in far East Gippsland
Branchlets rigid, terete, smooth or wrinkled to slightly striate, pungent; rounded, divaricately-branched shrub of the mallee region, east to the Grampians and Bendigo
Inflorescence 12–30-flowered, tepals reddish, less often yellowish-brown or greenish, drying dark; disc shallowly lobed
Inflorescence 6–15-flowered, tepals white (frequently flushed reddish-pink upon ageing), drying pale; disc markedly lobed
